thread.title: Ghacks Deals: JustUnblock, unblocked Internet TV for 64% off
thread.title_full: Ghacks Deals: JustUnblock, unblocked Internet TV for 64% off

author: Martin Brinkmann
title: Ghacks Deals: JustUnblock, unblocked Internet TV for 64% off
text:
Ghacks Deals: JustUnblock, unblocked Internet TV for 64% off By Martin Brinkmann on October 22, 2015 in Deals - Last Update: October 22, 2015 3 
Most streaming services out there, especially if they are part of a TV network, limit access based on the geographical region of the viewer. 
This leads to situations where you may not be able to watch TV if you are abroad on holiday for instance. 
JustUnblock unlocks access to more than a hundred different entertainment networks and streaming services including Netflix, Hulu, BBC's iPlayer, Spotify or Pandora. 
It uses the DNS to unlock access to these services which has the benefit that the stream uses your Internet connections's bandwidth which often is better than that of a VPN or comparable solution. It works on all devices including desktop PCs, Macs, gaming consoles and mobile devices. 
The Ghacks deal gets you three years of unlimited JustUnblock access for $49 which is less than $1.40 per month (the usual price for that is roughly $150) You may be interested in a lifetime Getflix subscription instead (for $39) or in a Private Internet Access account (VPN) for two years for $59.95. Watch hi-def movies, television channels & radio streams from the world’s leading entertainment companies Use w/ all your devices simultaneously: PCs, Macs, iDevices, Android devices, game consoles & more Sample free streaming video & music from Spotify, ABC, CBS, Fox, NBC, BBC, iTV, Channel 4, Showtime, Crackle, Pandora, Vudu, Dailymotion, Vevo & more Gain access to Netflix & Hulu globally Love it or return it w/ JustUnblock’s 100% money back guarantee Enjoy efficient, helpful, & fast-acting support 24/7 Please share this article About Martin Brinkmann Martin Brinkmann is a journalist from Germany who founded Ghacks Technology News Back in 2005. He is passionate about all things tech and knows the Internet and computers like the back of his hand. You can follow Martin on Facebook , Twitter or Google+
